intro: Machaeranthera pulverulenta, commonly known as the dustflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and gravelly slopes. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
